programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple running a guesthouse in Portugal welcome their first visitors. In Italy, two vineyard owners begin harvesting their grapes by hand. And there are wedding bells in Spain.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Herefordshire, Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo meet George, a collector for over 70 years. Max finds a crate of vintage motor oil bottles that could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Ade Adepitan in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lucy's been thinking about buying a home abroad since she was 16 and is now ready to take the plunge. Jean Johansson shows her what Mlaga has to offer for 100k.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: The new series concludes. It's a happy ending in France as Louise and Paul near the completion of their village and Tracey and Budo celebrate finishing their kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The new run continues. On payment day, the B&Bers clash over furniture failings and clock complaints. And sparks fly - ironically - over a lack of electricity. Who's won?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: A fishy feud leaves a bad taste at Bernadette's Italian meal in Glasgow. And who wins the week? (Ep5/5)

programme.title: New: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Moto GP fan Jackie and her daughter Tayla want a holiday home in rural Valencia for 150k. Will any of Jean Johansson's wow-factor villas or rustic retreats get their hearts racing?

programme.desc: Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.

programme.title: Live: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker kick off a brand-new series of the award-winning chat show with special guests Frank Skinner and Stevie Martin.

programme.title: Greg Davies: Firing Cheeseballs...
programme.desc: ...at a Dog: Greg's hugely successful and acclaimed debut stand-up show from 2011, which was a huge hit at the Edinburgh Festival and went on a sell-out, UK-wide tour.

programme.title: Attack the Block
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi horror-comedy with John Boyega. Aggressive aliens unwisely pick a tough London estate as the beachhead for their invasion. But the locals are no pushovers...

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Casa Roma: Gordon visits Casa Roma, the oldest restaurant in Lancaster, California. Although the bar is a success, the restaurant is failing and has had 20 chefs in two years.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wigan. Super-organised hospital theatre practitioner Geoff Conway goes all out to impress with an epic nine-course Spanish tapas feast. But are his portions too big? (Ep1/5)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wigan. Hairdressing salon owner Natalie Crompton plans an evening filled with fun and laughter, and names her courses after her beloved cats. But Geoff gets the claws out. (Ep2/5)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wigan. Music teacher and funeral singer Alan Gregory hopes to hit the right notes with an evening of sophisticated Greek grub. But Geoff barely touches his food. (Ep3/5)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wigan. Gymnastics teacher Simon Grimwood hosts on his birthday. But will it be many happy returns for Simon, or will there be tears at his party? (Ep4/5)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wigan. Nurse practitioner Caroline Heaven hopes to end the week with a bang by showing her rival diners a 'proper' Lancashire night. Will her guests be chuffed t' bits? (Ep5/5)

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien restore a metal workbench, a pine chest and the seat from an old pony and trap.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programme.desc: ...List It: Lexie and Ed's four-bed, one-bath Nottingham home is too small for their family of six. Ed wants to move but Lexie loves the location. Who can help, Kirstie or Phil?

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: The Guy Can't Help It: When Rebecca is attracted to a handsome plumber who comes to the bar, Sam's not very impressed. But Rebecca convinces Sam he's no great catch himself.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: One for the Road (Part 1/3): Don the plumber asks Rebecca to marry him - what answer will she give? Sam sees Diane on a TV awards show and tries to get back in touch with her.

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: One for the Road (Part 2/3): Woody's new job as a city councillor enables him to help Norm get a job. And is a reconciliation on the cards for Sam and Diane?

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: One for the Road (Part 3/3): In the last-ever episode, Sam and Diane are plagued by doubts about the idea of getting back together, while the gang ponder the meaning of life.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Misery Loves Company: Robert and Amy's over-the-top affection annoys Debra and Ray.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The Contractor: Debra persuades Ray to hire Gianni to do some DIY work in their kitchen, but they both come to regret it due to their friend's laziness.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Peter on the Couch: When Amy invites her brother Peter to stay for dinner, he makes himself at home on the couch... and never leaves.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Taking Liberties: Frasier hires a butler, who spoils everyone and offers Frasier sage advice in his bid to join the snobbish opera board.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Legal Tender Love and Care: Frasier starts dating the attractive attorney who defended him against Donny - who was jilted at the altar by Daphne.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Deep Space Homer: NASA recruit Homer and Barney to make the organisation more appealing to the common man. When Barney has too much to drink, Homer is chosen to go into space.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Loves Flanders: Homer realises that he likes Flanders and starts to hang around with him all the time. Unfortunately, Flanders realises that he's not so keen on Homer...

programme.title: F1 United States GP Sprint...
programme.desc: ...Qualifying Highlights: The fourth sprint race of the season kicks off in the USA as the drivers fight for those all-important bonus championship points. Who'll make it to pole?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Lincolnshire, where hosts Ryan and Hollie have a unique style and 15,000 mannequins up their sleeves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mum and daughter Holly and Meg host the week's second visit at their Nottinghamshire glampsite, where they aim to make glamping even more glam.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tom's already let all his competitors know that he runs the best place in Richmond, North Yorkshire. So why's he feeling so hard done by at feedback time?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brittany hosts the week's final visit in Windermere, where the B&Bers enjoy an arty afternoon. But faces drop when it comes to the cost.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It's been a fiery week, and every last one of the B&Bers is unhappy with their feedback. So expect more fireworks when they meet up once again to find out who's won.

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A couple turn an army lorry and an old caravan into an off-roader. A man builds a luxury cabin on his family's farm. And George checks out a home that was once a skip.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In London and Sussex, Phil catches up with Robin and Colin, who only had eyes for an architectural gem, and Lia and Andrew, who were done with renting and wanted their own home.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programme.desc: ...List It: In Newtownards, Amy and Brian are at loggerheads over their five-bed chalet bungalow. Can Kirstie make it feel like new again, or will the grass be greener elsewhere?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Jon and Noreen dreamt of living in a giant treehouse in Gloucestershire. But three years into the build, the money ran out. Are they finally living up in the trees?

programme.title: New: Great British Train...
programme.desc: ...Journeys from Above: Aerial cameras track the Ffestiniog Railway as it races through Eryri changing Welsh history, from coastal Porthmadog to Blaenau Ffestiniog's slate mines. (Ep2/4)

programme.title: The Menu
programme.desc: (2022) Horror with Ralph Fiennes and Anya Taylor-Joy. Only one diner at an exclusive eatery sees through the foam quenelles to the pile of steaming prairie oysters beyond. Mayhem ensues.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: New: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Armed with 100k and nothing but determination and forest timber, Marcus and Abi defy convention by building an off-grid home with no detailed plans in 20 acres of Pembrokeshire woodland.

programme.title: New: Britain's Most Expensive...
programme.desc: ...Houses: Can Josh seal a 15m deal in Sandbanks and bag his client a new pad? George Washington's ancestral home goes up for sale. And a 3m Essex home needs selling fast!

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: In an egg-ceptional Bake Off first, it's Meringue Week, and the bakers whisk up tarts, souffls and ice cream cake. Who can keep their cool? Whose souffl will be in disarray?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sante La Brea: Gordon visits Sante La Brea, a health food restaurant in Hollywood. But there's nothing glamorous about this eatery as owner Dean faces financial ruin.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Fiat Uno Turbo: In Wellingborough, Tim and Fuzz fix up one of the fastest hatchbacks of the 80s. Owner Gerry's ill health has meant that his Uno has been left to rot on his drive.

programme.title: Minimum
programme.desc: South Asian Film Season. (2024) Rumana Molla's poignant drama about a newly-wed woman who's held captive by her mother-in-law. But a blossoming friendship saves her. With Saba Azad.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The...
programme.desc: ...Professionals: In south Wales, Prego's carbonara gets compliments. But can they beat La Cocina Tapas' fresh Spanish servings and the Lamb and Flag's posh pub grub?

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie whips up super-speedy smashed lemongrass chicken, flavour-packed sweet potato chilli with homemade nachos, and a chocolate party tray cake with tinned mandarins and buttercream. (Ep5)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programme.desc: ...List It: Kirstie catches up with Catherine and Nigel, who were at a loss over their disjointed home in Larne. With the decision too close to call, did they stick to their guns?

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Another chance to see yesterday's new episode, with Ade Adepitan in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Roast Chicken: Doug has to make a speech at a party for Carrie's boss, who he hardly knows.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Fatty McButterpants: Doug asks Carrie to tell him how she feels about his weight, but when she does just that, he can't resist getting his revenge by picking faults with her.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Class Struggle: Doug feels neglected when Carrie decides to go back to college. Guest starring Ricki Lake as Doug's sister.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Baggage: Ray and Debra get involved in a two-week battle of wills over who's responsible for putting away a suitcase.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The Bachelor Party: Debra and Marie make Raymond feel guilty when they find out that the bachelor party he hosted for Robert was a huge disappointment.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert's Wedding (Part 1/2): Robert is suspicious of Peter's attempts to bury the hatchet, prompting him to ask Ray to keep an eye on him.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Three Faces of Frasier: Frasier becomes obsessed with a caricature of him that hangs on the wall of a Seattle restaurant.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Dark Side of the Moon: Daphne buckles under the strain of planning her wedding, knowing deep down that it's because her true love is not the man she's marrying.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Something Borrowed, Someone Blue (Part 1/2): Frasier offers romantic advice to Niles and Daphne, hoping that they'll admit their love for one another before her wedding.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Something Borrowed, Someone Blue (Part 2/2): Will Daphne admit her affection for Niles before she marries Donny?

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Sara Bittorf, the chief brand officer of Boston Market - whose 470 restaurants serve home-style comfort food - goes undercover to work alongside the chain's employees.

programme.desc: Channel 4's midday news summary.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Money dries up for B&B owners in Spain, while in Portugal the heat is on to get a guesthouse ready. And a severe drought in Italy threatens the future of a vineyard.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Windsor, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet Roy, whose garages are stacked full of bikes. Henry picks the one that doesn't work, and Simon converts some wooden beams into lamps.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The new run continues. For the final visit the B&Bers go glamping again, at Phil and Jane's site in Derbyshire, where the stag-gering views include real-life deer wandering about the place.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Glasgow, will Garry's exclusive Ibiza beach club evening be filled with more disagreeing than VIP-ing? (Ep4/5)

programme.desc: Heather and John want a characterful bolthole on beautiful Crete. Jasmine Harman shows them detached delights and an ice cream inspiration for 150k. Are any of them 'the one'?

programme.desc: Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.

programme.desc: ...the Wild: On Australia's extremely remote and breathtaking Lord Howe Island, George explores a stylish secluded coastal retreat and dives into a Pacific paradise of coral gardens. (Ep3)

programme.desc: ...90 Days: In this entertainment special, Oobah Butler has just three months to make a million. A rollercoaster of big wins and setbacks follows as Oobah's conscience starts to bite.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Amy Gledhill take on Richard Ayoade and Guz Khan. Sam Campbell joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.

programme.desc: Cafe 36: Gordon Ramsay visits Cafe 36 in Chicago. Husband-and-wife team Terry and Carol are stuck in the past and their head chef's lax attitude is driving away customers.

programme.title: The Mustang
programme.desc: (2019) Heartfelt drama with Matthias Schoenaerts. A violent convict gets a chance at rehabilitation through a programme training wild mustangs. Will he make the most of his second chance?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The
programme.desc: Professionals: In east London, Bombetta let their ingredients do the talking but can Jellyfish's Lebanese-inspired street food liven things up or will Omnino raise the 'steaks'?

programme.desc: ...List It: Kirstie and Phil meet Heather and Tim, whose seven-acre home near Edinburgh has a dysfunctional layout. Tim wants somewhere more rural but Heather wants to stay put.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Strike One: Doug and Carrie agree that they shouldn't buy a new car because Doug's union may be going on strike. But Doug can't resist a new off-roader...

programme.desc: Fun with Debra: Debra convinces Ray that she should join him on the golf course after she realises that they don't have fun together any more.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: And the Dish Ran Away with the Spoon: In a double-length episode, Niles and Daphne discover that there's a price to pay for admitting their true love.

programme.desc: The Bad Son: Frasier begs Martin to take a tour of a senior citizens' home so that he can ask out its attractive manager.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Great Crane Robbery: Frasier's bootlicking routine backfires when he invites his new boss, a nouveau-riche internet millionaire, to his tastefully decorated home.

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: (1999) Drama with Tom Hanks and Michael Clarke Duncan. Strange events occur when a man convicted of raping and murdering two young girls arrives on death row in a Louisiana prison.

programme.title: The Last King of Scotland
programme.desc: (2006) Oscar and BAFTA-winning Forest Whitaker stars as Idi Amin - the murderous Ugandan dictator, who mesmerises a young Scottish doctor, played by James McAvoy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: Storm over the Nile
programme.desc: (1955) Drama. Anthony Steel stars as a disgraced soldier who, during the British army's 1898 campaign in Sudan, goes way beyond the call of duty to prove his courage. With Laurence Harvey.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: (1961) World War II comedy starring Jack Lemmon. A luckless naval lieutenant is duped into commanding a dangerous mission into enemy territory during the Battle of the Bismarck Sea.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: (1952) Civil War-era Western. A unit of Confederate soldiers attack a Union troop to steal gold. Learning that the war is over, they must finish the mission in disguise.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: (2015) Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance star in Steven Spielberg's Cold War spy drama. After gaining notoriety for defending a Soviet spy, a US lawyer then tries to free a CIA pilot.

programme.title: Mean Streets
programme.desc: (1973) Scorsese's classic crime drama about the ordinary lives of mafiosi - the boredom, casual violence and shattered dreams - in Little Italy, with Harvey Keitel and Robert De Niro.

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: (2013) Dark psychological thriller. Jesse Eisenberg stars as a timid man whose drab existence takes a turn for the worse with the arrival of a new colleague at work. With Chris Morris.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: (1949) This dark comedy from Ealing studios sees Alec Guinness take on the roles of eight characters, all the noble victims of a vengeance-seeking relative, played by Dennis Price.

programme.title: San Demetrio, London
programme.desc: (1943) Fact-based drama about a group of Merchant Navy sailors who brave fire and the ocean to save the San Demetrio oil tanker after it's almost destroyed by a German cruiser.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: (1951) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a rancher who's the target of unwelcome harassment by his richer and more powerful neighbour. With Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.

programme.title: The Iron Petticoat
programme.desc: (1956) Comedy with Katharine Hepburn and Bob Hope. A Russian captain defects to London, falls for the charms of Major Lockwood, and tries to convince him of the beauty of communism.
